intro: Anagallis elegantula, commonly known as the pretty willow herb, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features slender, willow-like stems that are often hairy and have a reddish tinge. Its flowers are small, five-petaled, and range in color from white to pink, blooming in clusters at the tips of the stems. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along streambanks.
